title: Cross-Divisional AI Network (BCAI)
summary: AI network spanning research and business divisions enables AI in virtually every product—from cooking appliances to autonomous vehicles

content.whatItIs: The Bosch Center for Artificial Intelligence (BCAI) is not a traditional centralized lab but a network of experts from both Bosch Research and business divisions, enabling AI in virtually every product and technological development.
howItWorks: Network structure: experts from both central research AND business divisions—not a traditional centralized lab
Enables AI expertise to flow into virtually every product development
2.5B euro AI investment by end of 2027; software/sensor business expected to exceed 10B euro by mid-2030s
Leadership: Dr. Michael Kessler joined board focusing on AI research, application, industrialization
CES 2026 demos: AI cockpit systems with LLMs, agentic AI for manufacturing, connected cooking appliances
content.coreInsight: Rather than a centralized AI lab, create a 'network' of AI experts spanning research and business divisions. This enables AI expertise to flow into virtually every product development. The network model suits diversified industrial conglomerates better than a single lab, as it maintains domain context while sharing AI methodologies. Board-level AI leadership signals strategic priority.
content.keyMetrics: 2.5B euro AI investment by 2027. 10B+ euro target for software/sensor business by mid-2030s. CES 2026: 'people-centric technology' vision.
